str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To call to myself, summon. Middle voice from pros and kaleo; to call toward oneself, i.e. Summon, invite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To flay, flog, scourge, beat. A primary verb; properly, to flay, i.e. to scourge, or to thrash.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly. From para and the base of aggelos; to transmit a message, i.e. to enjoin.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.
